conclusion: Understand the relationship between refractive indices and illuminated areas.
Point light source S is below the water surface; monochromatic light A has a smaller radius than B; polychromatic light illuminates the larger area.
The radius of the illuminated area depends on the refractive index; smaller refractive index means larger radius.
Refractive index of light A is n1 and of light B is n2; n1 < n2.
Monochromatic light A will have a larger radius of illumination than B.
Light undergoes refraction according to Snell's Law.
Snell's Law: n1 sin(θ1) = n2 sin(θ2).
Find the sine value of the refraction angle θ2 for monochromatic light B.
Using Snell's Law: sin(θ2) = n1 sin(θ1) / n2.
The radius R of the illuminated area is proportional to sin(θ2).
Final answer: sin(θ2) = n1 sin(θ1) / n2.
